column4: E: Unable to lock the administration directory (/var/lib/dpkg/), is another process using it?
close synaptic and run the command again in terminal
read the message it gives you the answer :)
you may need to add sudo if it gives you a permission denied
then restart your X by holding alt-sysrq-k keys
ok run sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak  <<< this one (there is an extra space in the first one I gave you)
when you run the above command you wont see any output
How old is this Ubuntu install?
reinstall :) I know it's a real dirty fix but will get you back to default everything
that command will create a file called my-packages, it's a simple text file which will list everything you have installed at this point in time
sorry I can't help more then that
or hang around here and ask every now and then and someone might be able to help out
